title: Sam Kean, “The Tale of the Dueling Neurosurgeons” (Little, Brown and Co., 2015)
description:
Early studies of the functions of the human brain used a simple method: wait for misfortune to strike—strokes, seizures, infectious diseases, lobotomies, horrendous accidents-and see how the victim coped. In many cases survival was miraculous, and observers could only marvel at the transformations that took place afterward, altering victims’ personalities....
